data.title: Love The Marietta Square
data.text: So many great shops and restaurants!!  Very clean and charming atmosphere.   The Local Exchange, Sweet Treats, Two Birds Taphouse, Stockyard and so many more!

data.title: Quaint, but heavily trafficked area
data.text: Lovely place to stroll, shop, eat or drink.  It has unique stores, and has a small town atmosphere.  There are festivals for holidays, and often has some kind of activity.  The 4th of July was a perfect time to be there.  Fireworks, art show, lots of kids activities.

data.title: Cute but Crowded
data.text: I really enjoy the restaurants and cute shops in the Marietta Square. It is also a wonderful place to bring friends who are not familiar with the area. However, I advise to avoid this place like the plague during major holidays. Crowded with people and it is impossible to find parking or get into any restaurant. Even on regular weekends I spend most of my time there looking for parking or waiting on a table. I would rather spend my time somewhere else but if you've never been, sure, check it out at least once...just maybe on a Tuesday.

data.title: A Square on the Square
data.text: I have walked around the Square for over 30 years. quant shops, several bars, lots of restaurants. Traffic congestion is worse then ever. Sidewalks have keen widened. Lots of events are held there each year including weddings.

data.title: Great place to walk, shop and eat
data.text: Marietta Square has a variety of shops, some touristy, but all locally owned, restaurants for almost every palate, theater venues and monthly art walks and farmers markets.

data.title: Nice square but confusing traffic and one way streets
data.text: Square is surrounded by shops and restaurants.  Turn only lanes and one way streets are a little confusing.  Parking around the square is limited to 2 hours which isn't that much time if you are having a meal and doing a little shopping.  There are a couple of free parking lots in the area if the square is full.

data.title: Great town square!
data.text: We dropped in on a recent Sunday to visit the stores around this downtown square and they were holding Chalktoberfest in the square and on the streets around the square.  Great location for festivals and events - loved it!.

data.title: Family Friendly Step into History
data.text:
As the metro Atlanta area grows many of the agricultural market towns that developed along the RR have been lost to development.  While downtown Marietta is not immune the Square has maintained much of its original charm.

The southeast side is dominated by city and county government buildings.  The northwest side backs up to the RR tracks.  The old Kennesaw House hotel is home to the Marietta History Museum, an eclectic inexpensive attraction.  It is one of the oldest buildings on the Square and is infamous as the site of the stealing of The General by Union spies.

Nearby is the Lyric Theatre in the recently refurbished previous location of Theatre on the Square.  My wife, family, families, and I have enjoyed many well produced plays there.

Catercorner from the Lyric theatre is the recently restored Strand Theatre.  Glover Park fills the center of the square.  There is a small playground and a fountain.  Trees, benches, and a band stand rounds out the amenities.  Monthly concerts are performed there.

A variety of shops and restaurants surround the square offering a myriad of goods and foods. My young adult children enjoy spending time visiting.

An inexpensive afternoon or evening is close at hand on the Marietta Square.

data.title: Great park!
data.text: A great park nestled in the middle of all the high rise buildings and perfect place for a picnic with others

data.title: New Candy Store
data.text: Great new store that takes you back to your childhood.Find your favorite candy and reminise the old days. Staff very helpful. Can buy quantities for parties too.

data.title: A pleasant place to stroll
data.text: A visit to the square is a trip down memory lane. Those who hail from Marietta will marvel at the changes in businesses that occupy buildings over a century old. Newcomers will enjoy an old-time stroll around the square and through the park. Summer concerts fill the air, and food is everywhere. Try Sugarcakes for breakfast, the Vinyard for lunch, and Spring for dinner. Savor Aunt Sarrahs for ice cream, and have a pint at Johnny McCrackens. See a show at the Strand, or just sit and relax by the fountain in Glover park. The Square. Enjoy!

data.title: Charming
data.text: Lots of eating and shopping. Free parking on weekends plus farmer's market. Worth strolling if you're in the area, especially around meal time!

data.title: Chalktoberfest
data.text:
We went to Chalktoberfest last weekend and it was cool. The street art was amazing. Lots of Florida artist who were getting away from Hurricane Mathew. 
There was a beer garden with samplings of many breweries. 
There was a stage with live music. 
The restaurants were a bit jammed, and we did not have a pleasant experience, but we found a couple of food trucks and got a burger. 
An eclectic mix of people made for interesting people watching. 
Overall, a very nice, safe outing to Marietta Square.

data.title: Beautiful downtown square
data.text: This square is surrounded by beautiful old trees, blooming flowers and wonderful shops and cafes. The square was getting ready for a chalk art festival when I was there.  There is always something going on in the square.

data.title: Great place
data.text: We went to Chalktober festival and had a great time! They always have thing going on and it's great to go hangout with the family! Check out the farmers market on the weekends!

data.title: Great Saturday afternoon
data.text: My friends and I went to the Marietta farmers market last Saturday and had a great time however after the market closed at noon we took our dogs and watch through Marietta Square including sitting down in the park because it was a nice cool day. We had lunch at a local lunch place also sitting outside it was very enjoyable day and that was plenty of parking especially since I'm disabled I was pleased to be able to find a handicap parking spot which they seem to be plenty of.

data.title: It's always great
data.text: People watching, sitting in the sunshine, shopping, concerts, eating...the Square is a perfect spot for all of these. A great place for girlfriends day, couples, with the kids, or by yourself.

data.title: A taste of history
data.text:
Marietta Square is the heart of old Marietta and maintains much of the charm of the Old South. No antebellum homes here because this was the heart of the business district.

Divided into two distinct areas. The Square itself with it's fountains, monuments to the Civil War, play areas for the kids etc. Much to see and you should take at least an hour to see the whole Square.  There are a lot of flower beds, flowering trees and shrubs that have been carefully chosen to give a spring to fall treat of color. In fall when it begins to cool off and leaves change is a particularly good time to visit the square.

The second distinct area is not the Square itself but the restaurants, businesses and art gallerias that have gone into the old re-purposed building that surround the Square on all sides. Many different cuisines area offered and you have anything from a coffee shop, to a bistro to dinner at an elegant restaurant.

Take time and enjoy.  We've been numerous time and each is a treat.

data.title: Saturday stroll
data.text: Great place for every event during all seasons. We enjoy the restaurants in the square. Many different events all year long to enjoy with the family or friends. Parking can be a challenge at time. So many unique shops and restaurants along with lots of history in the area. Must go to downtown Marietta.

data.title: Marietta Square 911 Celebration
data.text: It was wholesome fun with music, families enjoying picnics, and Patriotism honoring the memory of 911.  I
